title: White Sox win draft lottery, will pick 1st in 2026
content: The White Sox, who had the best odds to win the 2026 MLB draft lottery, will pick first in next summer's draft, followed by the Rays at No. 2 and the Twins at No. 3.

title: Slot wonders if Salah thinks he 'made a mistake'
content: Liverpool coach Arne Slot questioned whether Mohamed Salah should be the one to initiate a conversation with him following his explosive interview at the weekend.

title: Big 12 commish: Irish AD's behavior 'egregious'
content: Big 12 commissioner Brett Yormark took issue Tuesday with Notre Dame athletic director Pete Bevacqua's criticism this week of the ACC, calling his behavior "egregious."

title: Dybantsa, Wright fuel huge BYU rally vs. Clemson
content: Behind the largest second-half comeback in program history, one fueled by AJ Dybantsa and capped by Robert Wright III, BYU took down Clemson, 67-64, in the Jimmy V Classic on Tuesday night.

title: Spurs rule Wemby out for Cup game vs. Lakers
content: Spurs superstar Victor Wembanyama has been ruled out for Wednesday night's NBA Cup quarterfinal game against the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: Paul 'at peace with everything' after Clips ouster
content: Chris Paul said he's "at peace with everything" and is excited for what's next following his stunning ouster from the LA Clippers earlier this month.

title: Minority owners target Ishbia's stake in filing
content: A filing in a lawsuit against Mat Ishbia includes new financial details that two Suns minority owners say could threaten Ishbia's majority ownership.

title: Sources: Schwarber back to Phils on $150M deal
content: Slugger Kyle Schwarber, who led the NL with 56 home runs last season, and the Phillies are finalizing a five-year, $150 million contract, sources told ESPN.

content: In knocking off former 1-seed Purdue, unbeaten Iowa State changed its trajectory and is now on the top line.

content: Here's everything you need from Orlando as big signings by the Dodgers and Phillies rock the winter meetings.

title: Not a 'layup': USA clash could be the most hyped in Socceroos history
content: Australia's game against the United States won't be the biggest World Cup match that the Socceroos have ever played -- but it might be the most hyped.

title: Vindication? Liverpool earns Slot much-needed win amid Salah saga
content: In a week dominated by the fallout created by Mo Salah's comments, Arne Slot and Liverpool showed plenty of resolve in beating Inter 1-0 in the Champions League.

title: How the 2026 World Cup killed the 'group of death'
content: Everyone wants to know: which teams are in the group of death for the 2026 World Cup? Well, the "group of death" may be officially dead.

content: Former powerhouse Wolfsburg's campaign is unraveling, while Real Madrid look poised to finish top-four in the UWCL table.

content: A growing number of athletic directors say they are interested in exploring a once-unthinkable option.

content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

content: The former Seminoles quarterback was excited about the Florida State's women's soccer team's fifth title ... and less than impressed by his old squad.

content: Bron Breakker's callout of CM Punk and Gunther's vow to make John Cena give up highlight Monday night's "Raw."

content: Arne Slot and Mo Salah can no longer coexist? Arsenal are feeling the pressure? Let's overreact to last weekend's Premier League action.

content: Liverpool are reportedly looking to improve their defense. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: Week 14 "set the tone" for many NFL teams as Super Bowl favorites faltered and underdogs picked up steam.

content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

title: Pickups: Ryan Nembhard, Quentin Grimes among players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Foster cruises past Fulton, moves up at junior lightweight
content: O'Shaquie Foster was dominant against Stephen Fulton, earning higher ranking. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Lando Norris isn't an F1 'badass.' His vulnerability makes him a unique champion
content: In a sport where athletes are expected to be "badass," newly crowned F1 champion Lando Norris' openness to talking about his emotions is a rarity.

title: Goa club fire: Police detains co-owner Ajay Gupta in Delhi
content: Interpol has issued a blue corner notice for nightclub co-owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, believed to be in Thailand, following a deadly blaze. Goa Police detained a partner and are seeking to impound the brothers' passports. A team is being sent to Thailand to bring them back, with authorities also investigating their finances.

title: IND vs SA: 'It's not about what Hardik wants, it's about India': 'Gutsy' Pandya sparks crushing win
content: Hardik Pandya's explosive unbeaten 59 off 28 balls powered India to a dominant 101-run victory in the first T20I against South Africa.  Pandya's calculated counterattack, fueled by intense fitness work and a team-first approach, set a challenging target.  A potent bowling attack then dismantled the visitors, securing a commanding win.

title: Watch: Pakistan army spokesperson faces backlash after winking at reporter
content: Pakistan's military spokesperson, Lt. Gen. Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry, faced criticism for winking at a journalist after she questioned him about Imran Khan. Chaudhry had previously called the former PM a "mentally ill person" and a "security risk," an unprecedented public stance by the military. Khan is currently serving a 14-year sentence.

title: Ford partners with Renault; CEO Jim Farley says itâ€™s â€˜fight for our livesâ€™
content: Facing intense competition from Chinese automakers in Europe, Ford is partnering with Renault to revive its European business. The collaboration will see Renault produce two small electric vehicles for Ford, utilizing Renault's technology platform. This strategic move aims to bolster Ford's presence in a market where it has been losing share for years.

title: Gujarat horror: 35-year-old man rapes 7-year-old girl, assaults with iron rod; held
content: A seven-year-old girl was brutally assaulted and raped in Rajkot, with an iron rod allegedly inserted into her private parts. Police have detained 35-year-old Ramsingh, a farmhand, who confessed to the heinous crime after kidnapping the child. The victim is stable and receiving treatment, while authorities are pursuing legal action.

title: Technology company CEOs caught smuggling Nvidia GPUs worth $160m to China
content: US authorities have busted a major smuggling ring exporting over $160 million in advanced Nvidia AI chips to China. Operation Gatekeeper led to arrests and guilty pleas, exposing a scheme using fake documents and shell companies. These powerful chips, crucial for AI and military tech, are now being kept from restricted destinations.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,850; BSE Sensex up over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,850, BSE Sensex was up over 100 points.

title: Explained: Why the current ICC broadcast rights are unsustainable - What next?
content: JioStar is not exiting its cricket media rights deal with the ICC. The broadcaster faces financial losses due to high prices. Cricket federations lack alternatives, forcing negotiations. This situation impacts future broadcast rights for major tournaments like the T20 and 50-over World Cups. IPL franchises are also concerned about declining brand value linked to broadcast revenue.

title: Threats to BLOs during SIR unacceptable: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has mandated all states to provide robust security for booth-level officers during voter enumeration, warning of severe action against any threats or obstructions. The court emphasized that non-cooperation with the Election Commission's work is a serious matter, extending beyond West Bengal to all states, and stressed the need for BLOs' safety to prevent anarchy.

title: Phoebe raises $30M for Phia; Bill Gates jokes about customer-service shift
content: Bill Gates' daughter, Phoebe Gates, has secured $30 million in funding for her AI shopping startup, Phia, valuing the company at $180 million. While Bill Gates has not invested financially, he has contributed his time and experience, even working a customer service shift to support the venture.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Nursing student frames cabbie for gang-rape to dodge boyfriend
content: A nursing student's gang-rape accusation against a cab driver near Bengaluru's Sir M Visvesvaraya Terminal has been debunked. Police found CCTV footage and WhatsApp chats suggesting a consensual encounter. The student reportedly fabricated the story to conceal scratch marks from her boyfriend, admitting to the false claim during questioning. The driver maintains his innocence.

title: 'Welcome to the club': Arshdeep Singh on what he told Jasprit Bumrah
content: Arshdeep Singh revealed his strategy for India's T20I win against South Africa, focusing on hitting the seam for early wickets. He dismissed two crucial batsmen, contributing to India's defense of 175. Arshdeep also welcomed Jasprit Bumrah to the 100 T20I wickets club, emphasizing the bowlers' aim to provide captaincy flexibility on a seaming wicket.

title: Miami elections: Eileen Higgins becomes cityâ€™s first-ever female mayor - who is she?
content: Miami has a new mayor, Eileen Higgins. She is the city's first female leader and the first Democrat in nearly thirty years. Higgins, a former county commissioner, defeated Republican Emilio Gonzalez. Her victory marks a significant shift in Miami's political landscape. She pledged ethical leadership and delivering results for residents.

title: Family drama: Bill Belichick's daughter-in-law takes jab at his 24-yr-old girlfriend
content: Bill Belichick's relationship with his 24-year-old girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, is facing family opposition. His daughter-in-law, Jennifer Belichick, publicly supported Bill's ex-girlfriend, Linda Holliday, after reportedly issuing an ultimatum to choose between family and Hudson. This public display intensifies the drama surrounding the coach's personal life.

title: 'Destroying entire village is not justice': Day later, Odishaâ€™s MV-26 turns ghost village; over 160 houses gutted
content: Malkangiri Village-26, home to Bengali-origin settlers, lies in ruins after a tribal mob torched over 160 houses following the beheading of an Adivasi woman. Residents fled, fearing for their lives, as security forces searched for the victim's head. The district administration has launched a special investigation and held peace talks, urging cooperation to restore order.

title: Inside George Springerâ€™s fairytale life with his wife Charlise Castro
content: Charlise Castro, a former Division I softball standout and America East Player of the Year, forged her own path beyond being George Springer's wife. After excelling in athletics, she pursued an MBA and built a credible career in wellness coaching, demonstrating ambition and resilience. Her journey highlights how partners of elite athletes can cultivate independent identities and success.

title: Ayesha Curry admits feeling anger when women try to pursue Stephen Curry
content: Ayesha Curry revealed on 'Red Table Talk' that she sometimes feels the urge to confront women who approach her husband, Stephen Curry, due to his naturally friendly demeanor. She later expressed regret about her appearance on the show, attributing the backlash to the platform's chaotic nature and the misinterpretation of her words.

title: Anna Kournikova & Enrique Iglesias 2025 net worth: Career, music and business
content: Tennis star Anna Kournikova and music icon Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of $160 million in 2025. While Kournikova's fame transcended her $4 million prize money through lucrative endorsements, Iglesias' wealth stems from over 130 million record sales and global tours. Both have strategically invested in Miami real estate, contributing to their substantial shared fortune.

title: Top stocks to buy : Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi's Mehul Kothari highlights three top stock picks for investors: Hindustan Copper, Hindustan Petroleum, and Shaily. These selections are based on technical analysis, including breakout retests and strong structural formations, suggesting potential for significant gains over the coming months and up to a year.

title: Tirumala dupatta scam: Those â€˜silkâ€™ may just be plain polyester; TTD flags decade-long fraud
content: In a shocking turn of events, the Tirumala temple trust claims a massive fraud involving silk dupattas. For the past ten years, a company allegedly supplied synthetic polyester under the guise of luxurious mulberry silk.

title: IndiGo chaos: 2.6 lakh flyers hit at Mumbai airport; 905 cancellations, 1,475 delays from Dec 1 to 8
content: IndiGo's operations faced significant disruption at Mumbai airport last week, leading to over 2.6 lakh passengers being affected by 905 cancellations and 1,475 delays. The Ministry of Civil Aviation conducted surprise audits at major airports to address the cascading impact on passengers and operations.

title: Honest review: 'Visited Neeb Karoli Baba's Ashram only to realise it might not...'
content: I have visited Neeb Karoli Baba's ashram several times. The drive to the serene pilgrimage site was an experience in itself . Tucked away near a stream, the ashram which houses a temple offered a unique spiritual experience-quite an unforgettable one.

title: IND vs SA: Not Kapil, Shami or Zaheer - Bumrah becomes first Indian to achieve this feat
content: Jasprit Bumrah achieved a remarkable feat in the first T20I against South Africa, becoming the first Indian bowler to claim 100 wickets in all three international formats. He reached this milestone by dismissing Dewald Brevis and Keshav Maharaj, adding to his impressive international tally. India secured a dominant 101-run victory in the match.

title: â€˜Dhurandharâ€™ day 5: Ranveerâ€“Akshaye film hits Rs 150cr in India
content: Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's 'Dhurandhar' is a box office sensation, crossing Rs 100 crore in its opening weekend and showing remarkable weekday strength. The spy thriller's impressive collections, nearing Rs 153 crore domestically, have propelled it into Ranveer's top-grossing films. Worldwide, it has already amassed over Rs 224 crore.

title: Small plane crash-lands on Florida freeway; hits car - watch video
content: A small plane made a dramatic emergency landing on a Florida freeway Monday evening, impacting a car. The aircraft, experiencing engine trouble, touched down on Interstate-95 in Merritt Island, striking a Toyota Camry. Miraculously, the two men aboard the plane escaped unharmed, while the Camry's driver sustained minor injuries.

title: John Cena and Shey Shariatzadehâ€™s 2025 combined net worth and luxury assets explored
content: John Cena and Shay Shariatzadeh's wealth is growing in 2025. Their combined net worth is nearing $82 million. John Cena's earnings come from wrestling and acting. Shay Shariatzadeh contributes from her engineering career and investments. Their financial journey shows a balance of earnings and investments. They own valuable properties, including a Florida home. Their lifestyle reflects comfort and privacy.

title: 2027 WC: Afridi slams Gambhir, says 'Virat & Rohit are backbone of Indian batting'
content: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi supports Indian stars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. He believes they are crucial for India's plans and should continue until the 2027 ODI World Cup. Afridi suggests resting them against weaker teams. He also commented on coach Gautam Gambhir's approach. Afridi expressed happiness over Rohit Sharma breaking his six-hitting record.

title: 'Will definitely sack IndiGo CEO if it comes to that': Civil aviation minister Naidu
content: Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu has apologized for the IndiGo passenger disruptions and vowed strict action, potentially including the CEO's removal. The probe will scrutinize the airline's operations and the Directorate General of Civil Aviation's (DGCA) oversight.  The minister acknowledged passenger distress, including exorbitant surge pricing, and assured accountability.

title: IPL Auction: 'Lot of attitude' - KKR coach opens up on released player
content: Venkatesh Iyer, released by KKR, enters the IPL 2026 mini-auction with a Rs 2 crore base price. Head coach Abhishek Nayar revealed Iyer's attitude and willingness to face adversity, not just his numbers, were key factors in his selection. Nayar highlighted Iyer's self-belief and conviction during trials as standout qualities.

title: 107 oppn MPs submit notice to remove Madras HC judge over lamp-lighting order
content: Over 100 opposition MPs have submitted a notice to the Lok Sabha Speaker seeking the removal of Madras High Court Justice GR Swaminathan. They accuse him of misconduct and bias in a recent order concerning a lamp lighting at a temple near a dargah in Tamil Nadu.

title: Goa authorities trashed own report on violations by club
content: Goa authorities allegedly ignored a report detailing "gross violations" at a property where a fatal nightclub fire occurred, dropping proceedings against the owner. Meanwhile, in Delhi, agencies are passing the buck over a vanished wetland, with the Municipal Corporation of Delhi and Central Pollution Control Board blaming each other for its disappearance under landfill waste.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Romeo Laneâ€™s Vagator structure demolished; razed twice, rebuilt illegally both times
content: Days after a fatal fire, authorities demolished an allegedly illegal restaurant-cum-nightclub structure at Vagator's Romeo Lane. This marks the third partial demolition of the structure in six months, with the tourism department citing repeated unauthorized reconstruction despite previous actions and a Bombay High Court directive.

title: Mike Tyson explains $40K monthly cannabis use and why family urged him to resume smoking
content: Mike Tyson revealed on a podcast that his family urged him to resume smoking cannabis after a brief five-day break, as his intense, unmedicated demeanor frightened them.  He explained that marijuana helps him manage his mood, maintain calm, and feel more like himself, contrasting it with the negative effects of alcohol.

title: Kids as young as 11 dabbling in drugs, shows 10-city survey
content: A nationwide school survey reveals alarming drug experimentation among Indian children, with initiation as early as 11 and an average age of 12.9.  One in seven students has tried psychoactive substances, with opioids and cannabis prevalent. Experts warn of easy access and emotional distress driving this trend, urging early intervention and parental vigilance.

title: Cam Newtonâ€™s children: Inside his family, baby mothers and all nine kids
content: Cam Newton's family size often sparks online curiosity, with the former NFL star now a father of nine. He embraces all children, including those from previous relationships, as his own, famously stating he doesn't believe in 'stepkids.' This inclusive approach to fatherhood explains his large, blended family, a topic that consistently resurfaces in public discussions.

title: Sparks fly over 'vote chori', SIR in Lok Sabha poll reforms debate
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the BJP of capturing the Election Commission, alleging it colludes with the ruling party to win polls and commits "vote chori." He criticized the government's move to exclude the Chief Justice from the EC selection panel, giving the PM complete control.

title: DGCA slashes IndiGo flights by 5%, govt doubles it to 10%
content: The government has doubled IndiGo's flight cuts to 10% following operational failures and crew norm non-compliance. This punitive action aims to stabilize the airline's services and reduce passenger disruptions. IndiGo's CEO was summoned to explain the mismanagement, with further reviews planned. Other airlines saw minor adjustments to their winter schedules.

title: EC can't determine voter's citizenship, but surely inquire into it: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court clarified that while the Election Commission cannot definitively determine citizenship, it can inquire about it if doubts arise regarding voters.  The apex court emphasized that Indian citizenship is a constitutional prerequisite for voting, not merely a matter of residence and age. This ruling supports the EC's stance on verifying voter eligibility.

title: Oppn belittling 'Vande Mataram' by linking it to Bengal polls: Amit Shah in Rajya Sabha
content: Home Minister Amit Shah asserted that the Congress's decision to divide Vande Mataram in 1937, as a concession to the Muslim League, initiated appeasement politics that ultimately led to India's partition. He emphasized the song's role in cultural nationalism and slammed the opposition for belittling its significance.

title: Andy Roddick & Brooklyn Decker 2025 net worth: Career, family and business
content: Tennis star Andy Roddick and actress-model Brooklyn Decker boast a combined net worth of $80 million in 2025. Roddick's lucrative tennis career and smart investments, alongside Decker's successful modeling and acting ventures, have built their impressive fortune. The couple, now raising two children in North Carolina, also actively supports charitable causes.

title: PMO reviews IndiGo flight disruptions with officials from Ministry of Civil Aviation, DGCAÂ and AAI
content: The airline has decided to remove 400 to 500 flights in order to stabilise its flight schedule or double what the government has ordered

title: Arunachal capital region shuts down over demand to oust migrants
content: Three youth organisations have also been protesting against unauthorised religious structures in the State

title: Bihar cabinet approves creation of three new departments
content: The three newly created departments are Youth, Employment & Skill Development, Higher Education, and Civil Aviation; DA hiked for employees, pensioners getting 5th & 6th pay

title: Everyone should register themselves as Hindus in upcoming census, asks VHP president
content: The VHPâ€™s request came in response to demands from various sections of society, like Adivasis, to include a separate religion code for them

title: The mysterious death of Annamalai University student Udayakumar 54 years ago
content: In July 1971, a controversy was triggered by Annamalai University conferring the honorary degree of Doctor of Letters upon then Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi. The sad aspect of the row was the death of K.P. Udayakumar, a third-year student of B.Sc. (Maths), under circumstances that have remained a mystery to date.

title: Torture in Madras 140 years ago: when a manâ€™s moustache was pulled out
content: Two mid-19th century testimonies reveal the brutal torture routinely inflicted by local officials in Madras; the accounts formed part of the Madras Torture Commission report

title: Goa police detain nightclub owner Ajay Gupta in Delhi
content: Two more owners of the nightclub â€” Saurabh Luthra and Gaurav Luthra â€” are on the run and a blue corner notice has been issued against them

title: Gemini Ganesan-starrer Avvaiyar brings alive temple at Thirumullaivoyal
content: I could not help reflecting on how much of a valuable record cinema is when it comes to capturing heritage for posterity. And at the same time, it also highlights what we have lost

title: Congress seeks M.P. Ministerâ€™s resignation over brotherâ€™s arrest for marijuana smuggling
content: Madhya Pradesh Congress president Jitu Patwari targeted the Bharatiya Janata Party Government over the issue and demanded that Ms. Bagri resigned from her post and Chief Minister Mohan Yadav gave up the Home portfolio

title: Committee to Protect Journalists writes to PM Modi, urges him to address the matter of jailed journalists
content: Noting that India is a signatory to the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, the non-profit press freedom organisation said it was incumbent upon the government to â€œuphold its international and domestic human rights obligationsâ€.

title: Kejriwal says Gujarat govt stopped him from meeting jailed farmers
content: He charged that the current administration had behaved in a manner â€œfar harsher than what our freedom fighters could have imagined from an independent Indian government.â€

title: No deaths due to air pollution, Centre tells Rajya Sabha
content: Health effects of air pollution are a synergistic manifestation of factors which include food habits, occupational habits, socio-economic status, medical history, immunity, heredity, etc. of the individuals, says Minister of State for Health Prataprao Jadhav

title: A deep cleaning of Indiaâ€™s electoral rolls
content: The revision and verification of electoral rolls is a routine and necessary process. Such corrections do not, by themselves, imply disenfranchisement or targeting

title: CM Revanth to visit Osmania University on Dec.10
content: The visit carries symbolic weight, coinciding with the 16th anniversary of the announcement to carve out Telangana as a separate State, on December 9, 2009

title: India, Brunei hold inaugural defence JWG meet
content: Key areas of discussion include the expansion of military-to-military exchanges, joint training and enhanced maritime security cooperation

title: Leh body seeks public input on fresh draft proposal for MHA on issues faced by Ladakh
content: The LAB seeks transparency and inclusive participation, rather than just social media comments, says its member, Mustafa Haji

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi questions EC, slams RSS, warns of threat to democracy in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi delivered a blistering speech in the Lok Sabha during the election reforms debate, accusing the government and the Election Commission of institutional capture, raising concerns over â€œvote chori,â€ and questioning changes to key electoral laws. He also criticised the RSS, celebrated Indiaâ€™s democratic spirit, and proposed urgent reforms to protect free and fair elections.

title: IndiGo flight cuts to spike airfares in peak season, leave passengers with few options
content: Back-of-the-envelope calculations indicate that reducing daily flights from 400 to 500 will affect 65,000 to 81,000 daily passengers, who had probably booked their seats weeks in advance

title: Land for integrated check-posts in West Bengal in different stagesÂ of acquisition: MHA
content: The West Bengal Government accorded approval for land acquisition only on November 21, 2023, and the Central Government has made the requisite payment to the State, Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said in a written reply to the Lok Sabha

title: BJP committing vote chori in collusion with Election Commission, says Rahul
content: The Congress leader claimed that the Modi government changed the law to give complete immunity to election commissioners for their decision but added, â€œwe are going to change the law and going to find youâ€

title: Telanganaâ€™s EODB measures, infrastructure, talent come for praise
content: A senior official of the Industries Department urged entrepreneurs to make most of the measures, while refraining from incentive shopping

title: India has to move from service provider to a product nation by exploring energies technologies: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Indiaâ€™s maiden full-fledged summit on supercomputing kicks-off in Yelahanka. The five day event being held at Manipal Institute of Technology campus features advanced computer technologies by 175 firms.

title: Debate on Vande Mataram an attempt to divert attention from economic issues: Opposition
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said Parliament can pay true homage to Bharat Mata by discussing and resolving the issues of common people

title: Donâ€™t sanction Eklavya schools until land already acquired: House panel tells govt.
content: Parliamentary Standing Committee on Social Justice and Empowerment notes that out of 722 sanctioned Eklavya schools for tribal students, 477 are functional, of which 341 are running from their own buildings and the rest operating in rented premises or other government buildings

title: Thirupparankundram row: Madras High Court summons Tamil Nadu Chief Secretary, ADGP
content: â€œLetÂ me remind the officials concerned that their duty is to enforce the law and not go by dictates that are often issued orally...  I have already ordered notice in the contempt petition. It is beyond dispute that the order of this court has been breached repeatedly,â€ says Justice G.R. Swaminathan

title: Watch: IndiGo cuts 400â€“500 flights amid DGCA orders to â€œstabiliseâ€ operations
content: The decision comes hours after the DGCA ordered a 5% reduction, citing the airlineâ€™s inability to operate its full approved schedule reliably

title: SIR is not new; several have taken place since 1952, Law Minister tells LS
content: Accuses Congress of â€˜vote choriâ€™ in first LS poll; JD(U)â€™s Rajeev Ranjan Singh asks why Opposition parties only question EVMs when they lose elections; NCP (SP)â€™s Supriya Sule says ECI appears to be part of government

title: Madras High Court permits Tiruppur Corporation to establish temporary waste storage site at Iduvai
content: Justice V. Lakshminarayanan expresses dismay over the Corporation having been dumping its waste in abandoned quarries for years together

title: Left parties slam bid to stoke communal tensions in Tamil Nadu
content: Joint statement accuses BJP of manufacturing controversy over Thirupparankundram Hill; urges people to uphold harmony

title: Speeches alone cannot attract UAPA charges, say Delhi riots accused
content: Defence argues speeches, however unpalatable, do not amount to criminal conspiracy; court to hear closing submissions

title: Your answers to the practical difficulties of electors are mechanical, cyclostyled: Supreme Court slams Election Commission
content: EC offers statistics in response to pleas for extension of deadlines by migrant workers in T.N., students in Kerala; SC says EC must protect BLOs along with States; EC blames hostile political parties for BLOsâ€™ stress

title: Mamata tears up Centreâ€™s note imposing conditions on MGNREGA resumption in WB
content: â€œDonâ€™t want your mercy,â€ says CM, rejecting conditions of an immediate labour budget, training; says State will expand its own Karmashree scheme instead; MGNREGA has been suspended in WB since March 2022

title: Watch: Manish Tewari questions Election Commissionâ€™s impartiality, calls for major reforms
content: Manish Tewari raises serious questions about the Election Commissionâ€™s impartiality and calls for major reforms in the selection process. He highlights concerns over EVM manipulation, advocates 100% VVPAT counting, and even suggests returning to paper ballots to restore public trust in democracy.

title: Ernakulam records 74.59% voter turnout in local body polls
content: The polling percentage surpassed the 2020 figure of 72.49% with municipalities recording 75.09% and tri-level panchayats 77.14% voter turnout

title: Vibrant â€˜Kottikalasamâ€™ marks conclusion of hectic campaigning in Kannur, Kasaragod
content: WithÂ KannurÂ remaining largely peaceful under heavy police deployment due to past tensions, â€˜kottikalasamâ€™ peak satÂ KanhangadÂ inÂ Kasaragod, where all three fronts are expected to face a close contest in the local body elections

title: Trade unions plan February general strike against Labour Codes
content: Ten central trade unions say Labour Codes must be withdrawn and prepare nationwide action aligned with wider protests

title: UDF rushing to offer clean chit to Jamaat-e-Islami, says Kerala CM
content: Pinarayi Vijayan alleges that the UDF is ready to align with organisations that have never been part of mainstream fronts, including those taking â€œcommunal extremist positionsâ€

title: Major fronts make last-ditch efforts to woo voters in Kozhikode
content: While the UDF focussed on the gold theft case at Sabarimala temple, the LDF raised the issue of â€˜tactical tie-upâ€™ between the Welfare Party of India and the UDF and highlightedÂ State governmentâ€™s achievements during the campaign

title: Goa nightclub fire: Interpol issues Blue Notice against 2 owners
content: An Interpol colour-coded notice alerts all 196 member countries of the Lyon-based organisation about a member countryâ€™s request to find particular information

title: Electioneering ends on a high note in Palakkad
content: Sulthan Pet emerged as the focal point of the celebrations, where thousands converged and engaged in lively cultural shows, bike rallies, and spirited processions.

title: Chief of the Naval Staff embarks on official visit to Brazil
content: The visit, from December 09 to 12, is aimed at consolidating the robust and steadily expanding maritime partnership between the Indian Navy and the Brazilian Navy

title: Robots in classroom: Telanganaâ€™s ATCs to help students acquire Industry 4.0 skills
content: Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka, during a session at the summit, said the government is planning to increase the number of ATCs to 105 by setting up another 40 across the State

title: CBI registers loan fraud cases against Reliance ADA Group firms, searches premises of Anil Ambaniâ€™s son
content: Agency books RHFL and RCFL in major bank loan fraud probe and searches the Mumbai premises of Jai Anmol Ambani as part of its investigation

title: "I Was Only A Partner": Detained Co-Owner Of Goa Nightclub To NDTV
content: NDTV confronted Ajay Gupta, the co-owner of the 'Birch by Romeo Lane' nightclub in Goa, where a massive fire broke out, killing 25 people.

title: Luthra Brothers On The Run, Co-Owner Arrested Over Goa Nightclub Tragedy
content: The Goa police on Tuesday arrested Ajay Gupta, one of the four owners of the 'Birch by Romeo Lane' nightclub, where a devastating fire claimed the lives of 25 people.

title: "Russian Oil Wasn't An Issue": Raghuram Rajan's Take On US Tariffs On India
content: The import of Russian oil was not the central reason for the Donald Trump administration's imposition of a hefty 50 per cent tariff on Indian goods in the United States, according to former Reserve Bank Governor Raghuram Rajan.

title: Telangana Bags Rs 5.75 Lakh Crore Investments At Rising Global Summit
content: Telangana has projected investments worth Rs 5.75 lakh crore following the two-day Telangana Rising Global Summit held at Bharat Future City, about 25 km from the Hyderabad airport.

title: Drop Everything And Focus On SIR: Yogi Adityanath To BJP Workers
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday issued a stern directive to BJP MLAs and party office-bearers: treat the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter lists as a top priority.

title: Elderly Jabalpur Couple Placed Under "Digital Arrest" For 4 Days, Rescued By Cops
content: A retired school principal and her husband were placed under "digital arrest" for four days at their Jabalpur home by cyber fraudsters posing as ATS officers and rescued by police on Tuesday when she told a lawyer about their ordeal, an official said

title: Mumbai Merchant Falls Asleep On Train, Loses Gold Jewellery Worth Rs 5.53 Crore
content: A Mumbai-based gold merchant's jewellery worth over Rs 5.53 crore was stolen after he dozed off during his train journey from Solapur to the state capital, prompting the police to launch a probe, officials said on Tuesday.

title: H-1B Visa Appointments Postponed For Many Indians Amid US' Social Media Rules
content: The US Embassy in India warned that any visa applicant arriving at the consulate on a previously scheduled interview date after being notified of a reschedule will be refused entry.

title: Goa Club Fire: Repeated Warnings For Years, Zero Action, Then Disaster
content: The very construction of 'Birch by Romeo Lane' was patently illegal, documents accessed by NDTV show, and 25 lives could have been saved if action had been taken on the notices - including at least one for demolition - issued against the nightclub.

title: Over 1 Billion Women Faced Childhood Sexual Violence In 2023: Report
content: Over a billion women worldwide aged 15 and above had experienced sexual violence during childhood, while around 608 million were exposed to intimate partner violence in 2023, according to estimates published in The Lancet journal.

title: Lawyers Request Hospital Transfer For Jair Bolsonaro For Surgical Procedures
content: Defence lawyers for Brazilian former President Jair Bolsonaro requested on Tuesday his removal from jail to a hospital for "surgical procedures," according to a document seen by Reuters.

title: Ashwini Vaishnaw Discusses AI, Tech Collaboration With Satya Nadella
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Tuesday met with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to discuss the role of artificial intelligence in public welfare, emerging technologies, and the importance of data sovereignty.

title: Florida Executes Man Convicted Of 1989 Murder, Marks 18th Death In 2025
content: A man convicted of fatally stabbing a woman during a home invasion decades ago was executed Tuesday evening in Florida. Mark Allen Geralds, 58, was pronounced dead at 6:15 pm following a three-drug injection at Florida State Prison

title: Global Trade To Surpass $35 Trillion In 2025 Driven By East Asia, Africa: UN
content: Global trade in 2025 is set to surge past $35 trillion for the first time, but the outlook for 2026 is more subdued, the United Nations said Tuesday.

title: Delhi Pushes For Faster, Transparent Fire NOCs After Goa Nightclub Fire
content: Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Tuesday ordered a revamp of Delhi's fire safety NOC process, aiming to make it simpler and faster for businesses. The move comes after a nightclub fire in Goa killed 25 people, exposing gaps in fire safety nationwide.

title: Imran Khan "Kept In Illegal Isolation", Says Sister Amid Protest Outside Jail
content: Aleema Khan, sister of former Pakistani Prime Minister and PTI founder Imran Khan, alleged that he is being subjected to mistreatment in Adiala Jail, as family members and supporters gathered outside the prison to protest his condition.

title: Video: Pak Army Spokesman Winks At Woman Reporter During Presser, Faces Backlash
content: Lieutenant General Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry, the Director General of Pakistan's Inter-Services Public Relations, faced extensive backlash after he winked at a journalist after answering her question regarding Imran Khan.

title: Elon Musk's X Says Would Comply With Australia's Social Media Ban
content: Elon Musk's X said Wednesday it would comply with Australia's world-leading crackdown banning under-16s from social media.

title: From Rs 1.11 Lakh To Rs 3.45 Lakh: Odisha Approves Big Salary Hike For MLAs
content: The Odisha Assembly on Tuesday increased the monthly salary of its members more than three times -- from Rs 1.11 lakh to Rs 3.45 lakh, one of the highest in the country.

title: Honduras President Alleges Trump "Interference" In Elections
content: Honduran President Xiomara Castro on Tuesday denounced what she called tampering with results in the recent general election, and accused US counterpart Donald Trump of interfering in the vote.

title: After Oz ban on social media for under-16s, experts suggest bottom-up solutions in India
content: Pearl Dâ€™Souza is a principal correspondent at The Times of India, having dedicated nine years to journalism. She covers health, along with a wide range of other topics. She is particularly focused on the rapidly evolving health sector, with special emphasis on public health infrastructure. Her reporting spans education, science, and technology, food. She was certified as a Climate Correspondent by the Fulbright-Hays Public Diplomacy Program, organized by the US Mission India in 2024, and is a 2025 candidate for United Nation's RAF memorial journalism fellowship. Read More

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Women's Bracketology: How the Big Ten is shaping the field
content: 16 new teams entered the bracket this week and 26 more moved at least one seed line . the big Ten was the exception for a conference that is consistently putting 13 teams in the field . Michigan State was held to just 64 points in a loss at Wisconsin .

title: 'It's an advantage': How post-ups became the NBA's most efficient play
content: post-ups were once a staple of inside-out offenses across the league . but by 2019, they'd been declining in frequency for years . in a post-game rant, a coach on the Dallas Mavericks explained why .

title: Once his coaching mentor, could Pep Guardiola spell Xabi Alonso's end in Madrid?
content: pep Guardiola's side face real madrid in the champions league on saturday . Xabi Alonso was installed as a midfield general at bayer leverkusen in august 2014 . the spaniard says he learned so much when working for guardiola at the age of 32 .

title: A No. 1 recruit, retention and role players: How BYU built a roster to contend
content: AJ Dybantsa announced his commitment to BYU in 2024 . the Cougars were the first five-star recruits since the ESPN recruiting database started in 2007 . a balanced mix of stars and role players has been a key factor for the team .

title: US visa chaos: Many H-1B interviews cancelled as social media review rule set to kick in
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. Read More

title: Eight teams, four matchups, one champ: Previewing the NBA Cup quarterfinals
content: the 2025 Emirates NBA Cup quarterfinals kick off on tuesday . leBron James goes off for 29 points to power the lakers to a close win over the 76ers . the team will have to advance without star Franz Wagner, who left the game because of a high ankle sprain .
